p: While these results are hypothetical, the figure suggests that even moderately effective face masks may be beneficial in “flattening” the curve of infection-related deaths. A summary of the data here highlights that 80% adoption of 50% effective masks could prevent 17–45% of projected deaths over a time frame of two months in New York, NY, USA [ 69]. It was concluded that the use of face masks should be nation-wide as possible and enforced without delay, regardless of the quality of the mask [ 69].
